input:
Dortmund 1 - 1 Anderlecht

First Half:

13:49 Event: Ball out of play
14:01 Event: Clearance by Anderlecht
14:05 Caption: Nuri Sahin (Dortmund) is unable to feed a through ball into the path of his teammates. The ball goes out of play and Anderlecht will have a goal kick.

18:45 Caption: Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) passes the ball into the box but an opposing player clears. The ball is behind the touchline and Dortmund will take a throw-in.
18:59 Caption: Erik Durm (Dortmund) is adjudged offside.
19:18 Event: Indirect free-kick by Anderlecht
19:24 Event: Foul by Dortmund
19:44 Event: Indirect free-kick by Dortmund
19:50 Caption: Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) brings an opponent down and Alberto Undiano Mallenco interrupts the game.
20:03 Caption: Olivier Deschacht (Anderlecht) takes the free kick from a long way out but the defender manages to get it clear.
20:53 Caption: Frank Acheampong (Anderlecht) sends a cross into the box, but Mitchell Langerak comes off his line to gather the ball.
21:57 Caption: Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) attempts to find one of his teammates inside the box with a chip pass, but one of the defending players reacts superbly and intercepts the ball.
22:05 Event: Offside by Dortmund
22:18 Caption: The game is interrupted as Marcel Schmelzer (Dortmund) is flagged offside.
22:30 Event: Indirect free-kick by Anderlecht

22:47 Event: Ball out of play
23:03 Caption: Dennis Praet (Anderlecht) tries his luck with a shot from long range, but his effort is well blocked by one of the defending players. The ball goes behind for a corner. Anderlecht will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
23:12 Event: Corner by Anderlecht
23:36 Caption: The resulting corner from Dennis Praet (Anderlecht) comes to nothing.
23:56 Caption: Leander Dendoncker (Anderlecht) extricates himself from the difficult situation with a good pass, comfortably eluding the pressing opponent.
24:55 Event: Foul by Dortmund
25:10 Caption: Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) makes a strong challenge and Alberto Undiano Mallenco blows for a foul.
25:16 Event: Indirect free-kick by Anderlecht
25:37 Event: Shots off target by Dortmund
25:37 Event: Ball out of play
25:54 Caption: Ciro Immobile (Dortmund) makes a decision to dribble through the defence towards the goal. He gets inside the box, pulls the trigger, but hits the ball very poorly and it goes yards wide of the target. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Anderlecht.
26:01 Event: Clearance by Anderlecht
26:49 Event: Shots on target by Dortmund
27:29 Caption: Anthony Vanden Borre (Anderlecht) crosses the ball forward but it is intercepted.
28:26 Event: Shots on target by Dortmund
28:27 Event: Ball out of play

29:02 Caption: Marcel Schmelzer (Dortmund) takes the corner.
29:04 Event: Corner by Dortmund
29:07 Event: Ball out of play
29:25 Event: Clearance by Anderlecht
29:28 Caption: Kevin Grosskreutz (Dortmund) is quickest inside the box and leaps to connect with the resulting set piece. He produces a fine header, but it floats just over the crossbar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Anderlecht.
30:04 Event: Ball out of play
30:09 Caption: Anthony Vanden Borre (Anderlecht) sends a pass into the box, but his attempt is thwarted and cleared. Anderlecht have a corner.
30:28 Event: Corner by Anderlecht
30:31 Caption: The resulting corner from Dennis Praet (Anderlecht) is cleared by the opposition's defence.
30:41 Event: Shots on target by Dortmund
31:10 Caption: This was a piece of cake for Silvio Proto. Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) found himself some space after latching on to a pass, but his strike only went towards the middle of the goal and into the gloves of the prepared keeper.
31:19 Event: Ball out of play
31:24 Event: Throw-in by Dortmund
32:06 Caption: Marcel Schmelzer (Dortmund) delivers a long ball, but it lacks enough power to reach his teammates and is intercepted by one of the defenders.
32:29 Event: Ball out of play
32:35 Event: Throw-in by Dortmund
33:24 Caption: Ibrahima Conte (Anderlecht) plays a through ball inside the box, but it's too strong and Mitchell Langerak comes off his line to intercept.
34:45 Caption: Erik Durm (Dortmund) fails to send a pass into the box as his effort is cut out.
36:41 Caption: Dortmund players are exchanging short passes with one another, waiting for the right moment to beat the opposition's defence.
37:46 Event: Ball out of play
37:53 Event: Throw-in by Dortmund
37:57 Caption: A pass by Chancel Mbemba (Anderlecht) ends up in no man's land, and the attacking effort comes to an end. It's a throw-in for Dortmund.
38:14 Event: Ball out of play
38:19 Event: Throw-in by Dortmund
38:25 Caption: Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) once again attempts to send a defence-splitting pass, but the opposition's defence is alert and intercepts the ball. The linesman signals a throw-in for Dortmund.
38:44 Event: Ball out of play
38:56 Caption: Erik Durm (Dortmund) attempts to find one of his teammates, but puts far too much on the pass and the chance is gone. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Anderlecht.
39:06 Event: Clearance by Anderlecht
39:26 Event: Ball out of play
39:34 Caption: Kevin Grosskreutz (Dortmund) attempts to send a low pass into the box from the edge of the penalty area, but the opposition's defence knocks the ball to safety. Dortmund will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
39:50 Event: Corner by Dortmund
39:51 Caption: Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) swings in the corner kick, but one of the defenders leaps highest to head the ball away.
40:01 Event: Shots off target by Dortmund
40:02 Event: Ball out of play
40:08 Caption: Erik Durm (Dortmund) gets the ball from a rebound and shoots from long range, but sends the ball miles wide of the left post. The goalkeeper doesn't have to worry about this one. Very poor attempt. The ball goes out of play and Anderlecht will have a goal kick.
40:32 Event: Clearance by Anderlecht
40:48 Event: Ball out of play
40:59 Event: Throw-in by Anderlecht
41:18 Event: Ball out of play
41:35 Event: Throw-in by Dortmund
41:51 Event: Ball out of play
42:01 Event: Throw-in by Dortmund
42:07 Event: Ball out of play
42:14 Caption: Erik Durm (Dortmund) goes on a solo run, but he fails to create a chance as an opposition player blocks him.
42:29 Event: Clearance by Anderlecht
42:42 Event: Shots off target by Anderlecht
42:43 Event: Ball out of play
43:03 Caption: Unbelievable miss! Sacha Kljestan (Anderlecht) reacts superbly to latch on to a rebound, but he blazes the ball high over the crossbar! The ball goes out of play and Dortmund will have a goal kick.
43:15 Event: Clearance by Dortmund
43:18 Event: Foul by Dortmund
43:29 Event: Indirect free-kick by Anderlecht
43:43 Event: Ball out of play

44:12 Event: Ball out of play
44:37 Event: Throw-in by Dortmund
45:12 Caption: The match has reached half-time.
45:59 Caption: The fans must be pleased so far with the entertainment on the pitch. Let's hope the players don't lose their passion and determination during the half-time break. The visitors played second fiddle to the home team in the first half. Pass and move. The home side have played some possession football so far, while the visitors have been patient as they wait for the right moment to hit them on the break.

Second Half:
00:00 Event: Kick-off by Anderlecht
00:01 Caption: The second half gets underway.
00:12 Event: Ball out of play

03:29 Event: Clearance by Anderlecht
03:47 Event: Shots on target by Dortmund

03:52 Caption: What an amazing save by Silvio Proto! Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) swirls around the defenders and attempts to beat the keeper with a close-range shot low towards the middle of the target, but fails.

33:30 Event: Foul by Dortmund

34:03 Event: Indirect free-kick by Anderlecht
34:39 Event: Shots off target by Dortmund
34:40 Event: Ball out of play
34:47 Caption: What a big chance! Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball just over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and Anderlecht will have a goal kick.
35:02 Event: Clearance by Anderlecht
35:09 Event: Ball out of play

36:48 Caption: Dennis Praet (Anderlecht) swings in the corner, but it's comfortably cleared away.
36:54 Event: Corner by Anderlecht
36:57 Event: Shots on target by Anderlecht
37:10 Event: Shots on target by Dortmund
38:00 Caption: Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) takes the ball, nicely zig-zags through the defence, but his shot to the left post is smartly dealt with by Silvio Proto.
38:20 Event: Shots on target by Anderlecht
38:21 Event: Goal by Anderlecht
38:41 Caption: Anthony Vanden Borre sends a superb cross into the box. Aleksandar Mitrovic (Anderlecht) latches on to it and from close range plants a header into the top left corner, leaving Mitchell Langerak beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 1:0.
38:54 Caption: Substitution. Jakub Blaszczykowski (Dortmund) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Shinji Kagawa walks off.
39:17 Event: Kick-off by Dortmund
39:17 Event: Substitution by Dortmund

41:34 Event: Indirect free-kick by Dortmund
42:08 Event: Ball out of play

44:35 Event: Ball out of play
47:43 Caption: Anderlecht are showing great team chemistry. They are passing the ball around seamlessly.
48:14 Caption: Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
48:59 Caption: According to the statistics, the match was pretty entertaining. There were plenty of thrilling moments. The home side were dominant and dictated the tempo of the game. The home team made a lot of passes and attempted to maintain possession. The away side's tactic was counter-attacking.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
The match between Borussia Dortmund and Anderlecht proved to be a nail-biting encounter, ending in a tight 1-1 draw. Fans at Signal Iduna Park were treated to an energetic display of football, brimming with tactical plays, impressive saves, and moments of sheer brilliance from both sides.

With the referee's whistle, the game kicked off right as the clock hit 00:00. Dortmund made the first touch, showing their intent to dominate the proceedings from the opening seconds. However, within just a few seconds, at 00:04, the ball went out of play, signaling the first throw-in of the match, which Anderlecht took. The next few minutes were a blur of to-and-fro actions with multiple throw-ins and clearances by both sides. The early exchanges were dominated by Dortmund, who managed to get the first shots on target around the 03:35 mark, followed quickly by their first corner, showing early signs of their attacking prowess.

Marcel Schmelzer and Shinji Kagawa were pivotal in Dortmund’s midfield, consistently probing the Anderlecht defense, attempting to split their lines with their incisive passes. A notable moment came at 11:17, when Anderlecht’s Aleksandar Mitrovic latched onto a precise pass at the edge of the box and unleashed a powerful shot, only to be denied by the well-positioned Dortmund goalkeeper, Mitchell Langerak. This was immediately followed by a foul at 11:39, and an indirect free-kick for Anderlecht at 12:00 after Matthias Ginter of Dortmund was penalized for a tackle.

The game’s physicality picked up, with a series of fouls and free-kicks characterized by tussles in the midfield. At 12:10, a tackle by Ginter resulted in Dortmund conceding another free-kick. Dortmund, keen on maintaining possession and applying pressure, had many attempts thwarted as Anderlecht’s defense remained vigilant, especially with clearance actions around 14:01 and 20:03.

As the first half progressed, Dortmund had more opportunities to draw first blood. They showcased some intricate passing and movement, particularly highlighted at 15:17. Yet, Anderlecht's defense, marshaled by their goalkeeper Silvio Proto, stood firm. Notably, Kevin Grosskreutz’s (Dortmund) pass into the box was blocked around 17:42, showing Anderlecht’s resilience at the back.

The game’s tempo saw dramatic fluctuations. Dortmund’s aggressive approach often clashed with Anderlecht’s patient buildup. Around 25:37, Ciro Immobile of Dortmund missed a glorious chance, failing to convert despite getting himself into a promising position. His shot went well wide of the target, proving to be a squandered opportunity. Nevertheless, Dortmund kept pushing forward. Another close encounter came at around the 28-minute mark when Immobile’s mazy run and powerful shot was brilliantly saved by Silvio Proto. The ensuing corner taken by Marcel Schmelzer failed to yield a goal, adding to Dortmund’s growing frustration.

Clear-cut chances were hard to come by for Anderlecht, who found it challenging to breach Dortmund’s rigid defense. The duo of passing strategies and defensive interceptions characterized much of their first half. A memorable moment came at 43:03 when Sacha Kljestan of Anderlecht missed an open goal after reacting quickly to a rebound. His shot blazed high over the crossbar, much to the relief of the Dortmund faithful.

The first half concluded at 45:12 with both teams failing to break the deadlock. The crowd, however, remained optimistic, encouraged by the level of competitiveness and flair on display.

The second half began with Anderlecht taking the kickoff at 00:00, instantly indicating their intention to press high and disrupt Dortmund’s rhythm. The first notable action came soon after, as Shinji Kagawa almost created an opening, showcasing his creative prowess. Yet, his attempts didn’t result in a goal, exemplified by a missed chance at 01:09 when his shot went off-target.

Key moments came around the 12:50 mark when Ciro Immobile finally broke the deadlock. After receiving the ball inside the box and reacting quickly, he managed to slot it past Silvio Proto, tucking the ball into the right post, giving Dortmund a deserved 1-0 lead. The celebration was tempered by Anderlecht’s immediate kick-off at 14:03 and their spirited attempt to level the score.

Dortmund's strategy was evident. They intended to solidify their grip on the game by keeping the ball and hitting Anderlecht on the break whenever possible. Meanwhile, Anderlecht aimed to press higher up the pitch in search of an equalizer. Around the 17:42 mark, Ciro Immobile received a yellow card for a tactical foul, hinting at the rising tension and the stakes both teams were playing for.

As the clock ticked on, Anderlecht grew increasingly desperate. Aleksandar Mitrovic came close to scoring again around 20:59 but was flagged offside. Dortmund’s defense had its work cut out, frequently clearing potential threats and maintaining their narrow lead. The match saw several substitutions, evident around 23:37 and 33:17, as both managers looked to rotate their squads and inject fresh legs into the game.

Dortmund's persistence brought more shooting opportunities, often initiated by the likes of Henrikh Mkhitaryan and P-E Aubameyang. However, their efforts were met with a series of outstanding saves by Silvio Proto, who kept Anderlecht in the game with his impressive goalkeeping.

The turning point came at 38:21. A superb cross by Anthony Vanden Borre found its way to Mitrovic, who headed firmly into the top-left corner, leaving Langerak grasping at thin air and leveling the score at 1-1. This goal galvanized the momentum towards Anderlecht, while Dortmund looked to regain their footing quickly. The substitution of Kagawa for Jakub Blaszczykowski at 38:54 was an attempt to catalyze a winning goal, reflecting their desire to clinch all three points.

Dortmund pressed hard in the dying minutes. Erik Durm and Kevin Grosskreutz were particularly active down the flanks, persistently whipping in crosses and attempting to break Anderlecht’s resolve. Yet, the final whistle at 48:14 brought an end to their efforts, confirming the final score as a 1-1 draw.

The game was a testament to the attacking flair and defensive solidity of both teams. Dortmund displayed 71% possession, emphasizing their strategy to dominate through ball control and intricate passing. They registered more shots (21) compared to Anderlecht’s 9, showcasing their relentless assault on Anderlecht’s goal. However, Anderlecht’s counter-attacking play was crucial, providing a stark contrast to Dortmund’s possession-based approach and proving effective in snatching a valuable draw.

Ultimately, the match was a captivating spectacle for the fans. From end-to-end action to last-minute heroics, it had all the hallmarks of an enthralling football contest. Both teams demonstrated resilience, tactical acumen, and sheer determination. While Dortmund perhaps felt they deserved more out of the game given their dominance and chances created, Anderlecht’s pragmatic play and Mitrovic’s decisive strike ensured they left Signal Iduna Park with a well-earned point.
